messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Outside class/  Marty's costume, again
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: badolbilz  To:  Sent: Monday, November 03, 2003 10:12 AM Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "badolbilz" <ynxn96@...>
To: <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, November 03, 2003 10:12 AM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Outside class


> Sandra, it might be better to let Holly see the looks on their faces as
> they go into the school in the morning..

Exactly!!

I remember when mine were still in school and I'd watch all the buses go by,
after mine had gotten on.

Oh my,,,,, such sad, long faces. My kids were out of the school system
shortly after that.

I bet it will pass, for Holly, I mean.

The one thing I do like about the unschoolers who are here and and at a few
other places--- Is that you would allow her to go if she really wanted to.
I've met too many homeschoolers who wouldn't,, and it makes me sick.


I guess I have met some unschoolers who say they wouldn't allow their
children to go also, but I really find that contradictory to an unschooling
parenting style. I guess I would question what kind-of 'unschooling' they
do. Forced unschooling?? Hmmmmm......


Oh, and Sandra, tell Marty that I think his costume sounded hilarious!
Very creative thinking! I would have gotten a kick out of seeing it.

He won't know me, but you could tell him I waved him down while he was
swimming at the conference, to tell him I was stuffing a DVD into your bag.
Maybe he'll remember that, maybe not. <g>.

Kelli~
